Problem:
Consider a transfer function in control theory, described by \\( H(s) = \\frac{N(s)}{D(s)} \\), where \\( N(s) \\) and \\( D(s) \\) are polynomial functions of the complex variable s. We investigate the behavior of the system's output \\( Y(s) \\) when the input \\( X(s) \\) is subjected to the Fourier Transform of a step function, i.e., \\( X(s) = \\frac{1}{s} \\).

If an additional filter described by \\( F(s) = e^{-sT} \\) (a time delay) is introduced at a time \\( t_1 \\) affecting \\( X(s) \\), will \\( Y(s) \\) at any time \\( T > t_1 \\) still represent the convolution of \\( H(s) \\) and \\( \\frac{1}{s} \\)?
Explanation: The introduction of \\( F(s) \\) results in \\( X(s) \\) being modified to \\( \\frac{1}{s}e^{-sT} \\), affecting the convolution process by shifting the phase of the input and thereby changing the output \\( Y(s) \\). The output will be a transitively modified version of the convolution between \\( H(s) \\) and the unmodified \\( X(s) \\).
